chunks.en: This year is really tough, being 'successfully' pressured into marriage has offended my parents, relatives, and friends.

Did you offend your relatives? The stronger you are, the more easily you will be 'forgiven.' If grandpa is strong, the aunt is close; if the father is strong, the uncle is close; if the mother is strong, the maternal uncle is close; if the son is strong, the nephew is close; if you are strong yourself, all relatives are close; if you are not strong, you have no relatives.

Don't worry too much, you'll offend them sooner or later. Life is long, as long as you don't listen to them, and aren't controlled by them, anything you do will offend them. It's just a matter of time, and it's the same for everyone.
So what if you offend them? You're not marrying them.
The sooner you offend them, the sooner you'll have a good life.

Agree with the person above, if you have your own ideas, you'll have to offend everyone around you sooner or later, break the things left over from your parents' generation, until you establish a new social distance that you feel comfortable with. I have a friend whose family is rich, and he never dated his entire life. The year before last, he found a net model who was obviously unsuitable for him and had a flash marriage. They separated last April, and this year on the first night of the Lunar New Year, he came to me to complain about the divorce. He had half of his money taken by the woman, and still thinks it's because they weren't meant to be.

@asd7160 You can tell he's just a recent graduate, hasn't even held a girl's hand, and is at the age where he's fascinated by big boobs. Read some books, the passion supported by dopamine can only last up to 18 months. After kneading for a year and a half, you'll find that kneading dough is more comfortableğŸ˜Œ
Tell them that oranges aren't the only fruit and everyone has their own way of living.

@chengchengya Because I have achieved the highest education, the richest experience, and the highest social level in the entire family history, my position is unshakable hahaha, no one is qualified to offer me any opinions or suggestions, so I can get married whenever I want.
I don't get it, why did being successfully pressured into marriage end up offending everyone? Shouldn't it be a blessing?
I married my junior schoolmate from university after dating for more than 7 years.
I think that being pressured into marriage is a sign that parents have no faith. They make their children's marriage and childbirth their own life goals.
@liuzimin There's a missing comma before 'æˆåŠŸ' (success)
I'm still envious of those who are pressured into marriage, it means their family has the capital to get married.
Why are you so resistant? Don't you have desires? Don't you want to touch big boobs...?

Find some news about 'welfare girls' and gold diggers to show your parents, and say that if they rush you, you might just find someone with historical problems, or someone who will drain their bank account, and ask them if they can accept that. Anyone can just talk.
@asd7160 Sounds like there's no need to take responsibility.

@liuzimin I think it's okay, most programmers have good incomes. Taking on family responsibilities in exchange for being able to knead big boobs every day sounds pretty good to me. Of course, it's not about rushing into finding someone random, you definitely need to find the right person.
Go crazy twice and no one will pressure you anymore.
Why donâ€™t you share some details? We have nothing to do during the New Year. We love to hear you chat.
@Takizawa How to resist the pressure of marriage urging? Just follow each other's rhythm.
